While it is important to develop and utilize a TB vaccine as soon as possible, it also is important to remember that evidence of TB disease has been discovered in humans occurring as far back as 9000 BCE
58 . Given this lengthy history between TB and humans, it is critical that we take the long view when developing vaccines for TB; whether we develop a vaccine by 2035 or by 2050 represents a rounding error from the perspective of human history.
